title: Paul Feig would make Ghostbusters reboot sequel 'if anybody wanted it'
text:
A sequel to all-female ghostbusters could happen (Picture: Rex / Getty)

Paul Feig has revealed he would absolutely love to make a sequel to his all-female Ghostbusters reboot.

The 57-year-old director explained he would do it ‘if anybody wanted it’.

‘Well, someday,’ he mused to the Guardian. ‘And I would actually make another Ghostbusters, if anybody ever wanted it, because I loved that world.

‘I was like a kid in a candy store.’

The 2016 film – which features an all-female cast including Kristen Wiig, Melissa McCarthy, Kate McKinnon and Leslie Jones – is a reboot of the original 1984 movie of the same name.

But it drew criticism online by trolls, who flooded the internet with negative reviews because of the female-led direction.

All-female cast of Ghostbusters reboot (Picture: Columbia/Feigco/Kobal/REX)

On the backlash, Feig remarked: ‘What is weird is when you come into something that brings a set of rules that are unbreakable because, as a storyteller, you’re like, why can’t I break that? Can’t I have fun with that?

‘But I will never apologise for it because I’m very proud of the movie,’ he added.

The new remarks came off the back of the announcement of a third Ghostbusters film, due to hit cinemas in 2020. It will feature many of the original 1984 cast members and will continue on from where the 1989 second installment (not the reboot in 2016) left off.

Dan Aykroyd, who featured in the original film, recently said: ‘We’ve got the Ghostbusters movie that we’re working on now, and I will have to be performing in that.’

Ghostbusters’ Dan Aykroyd confirms he is returning for new sequel (Picture: Columbia Pictures/REX)

He added: ‘It’s really good. It’ll be all, most of the original people. And then young stars… It’s gonna be great.

‘I’m so excited about it, and it’s just wonderful to be able to [go] back and revisit that. I don’t do the pictures anymore much, and I’m in that one.’

As well as Dan, Sigourney Weaver will also be returning for the upcoming film, and Dan says he ‘hopes’ Bill will sign on too.

The new ‘young stars’ will include Stranger Things’ Finn Wolfhard and Captain Marvel’s Mckenna Grace playing brother and sister characters.
